heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 17 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (197°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.3°C) and outside temperature (down 1.5°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 368 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm), cloud levels (up 662 m), and light levels (down 2650 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 368.0m lower than yesterday, 35.1m lower than the past week, 661.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 702m minimum and 2980m maximum, with an average of 1229.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1264.7m and 1891.5m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, the air will feel quite humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
